Headline: XLRI ‚Äô25 | Co-Founder Hintech Energy | CUSAT'21
Comment:
This whole ‚Äúburn for fun‚Äù culture got normalised because valuations stopped being tied to business fundamentals and started selling future possibility ‚Äî the promise of ‚Äúeventually‚Äù hitting EBITDA positivity somewhere in the infinite future.

The strange part is how the entire engine runs on vanity metrics like Active Users and Revenue per User, even when the product is free or priced so low that profitability becomes mathematically impossible. But the story sells, rounds keep coming, and post-money valuations keep skyrocketing.

And here‚Äôs the kicker ‚Äî with every new round, earlier investors still make money on paper. So if customers get the product free, founders get the capital, and VCs keep marking up their books‚Ä¶ who‚Äôs really complaining?

It becomes a perfect win-win loop ‚Äî until the day the music stops.
processed_comment: this whole burn for fun culture got normalised because valuations stopped being tied to business fundamentals and started selling future possibility the promise of eventually hitting ebitda positivity somewhere in the infinite future the strange part is how the entire engine runs on vanity metrics like active users and revenue per user even when the product is free or priced so low that profitability becomes mathematically impossible but the story sells rounds keep coming and postmoney valuations keep skyrocketing and heres the kicker with every new round earlier investors still make money on paper so if customers get the product free founders get the capital and vcs keep marking up their books whos really complaining it becomes a perfect winwin loop until the day the music stops
